summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between attorney Bruce Barket and an MCC official regarding the well-being and treatment of his client, Nicholas Tartaglione, who was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The emails discuss concerns about Tartaglione's mental state, a leak of false information about him, and an investigation into a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the same facility.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, expressing concerns about his client's mental health and complaining about a leak of false information regarding Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Client of Bruce Barket, incarcerated at MCC. Described by his parents as nearly incoherent and in poor mental health. Subject of a media inquiry regarding a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Tracy Connor
persons.context: Executive editor for NBC/Daily Beast who contacted the MCC official to confirm a story about Nicholas Tartaglione being questioned regarding a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a possible attack at the MCC, which led to media inquiries about whether Nicholas Tartaglione was questioned about it.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the legal representative for Nicholas Tartaglione, advocating for his well-being and addressing issues related to his incarceration.
Media inquiry suggests Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on Epstein at the MCC, linking them within the same correctional facility investigation.

events.title: Media Inquiry about Epstein Attack
events.description: Tracy Connor, an executive editor, emails an MCC official to confirm an NBC story that Nicholas Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.

events.title: MCC Official Responds on Investigation
events.description: An MCC official responds to Bruce Barket, stating the matter is part of an open investigation and no information can be shared, while also cautioning staff against retaliation.

events.title: Concerns Over Tartaglione's Mental Health
events.description: Bruce Barket emails that Tartaglione's parents found him nearly incoherent and in poor mental health, requesting a check on him and a visit the next day.

keyFacts: Nicholas Tartaglione, an inmate at MCC, was described by his parents as 'nearly incoherent' and in very poor mental health in July 2019.
An NBC story alleged Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on fellow inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC, prompting a media inquiry.
An MCC official confirmed an open investigation was ongoing regarding the matter and cautioned staff against retaliating against Tartaglione.
Attorney Bruce Barket was actively advocating for his client Tartaglione's well-being and addressing concerns about false information leaks from the facility.
